newsitem.title: USA: Saudi ups extra light U.S. Nov crude. [CORRECTED 17:30 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Saudi ups extra light U.S. Nov crude. [CORRECTED 17:30 GMT]

text.p: Saudi Arabia raised the price it charges for term contract extra light Berri crude oil for U.S. customers by 20 cents a barrel, oil traders said on Wednesday.
Arab light crude prices are raised by 15 cents/bbl, medium grade by 10 cents/bbl and heavy is left unchanged.
The change brings the November contract price for extra light Berri to $2 a barrel below the benchmark West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude price.
Arab Light is raised to WTI crude minus $2.85/bbl and medium to $3.75 below. Heavy remains at $4.40 below benchmark.
(Corrects benchmark and price calculations for Arab Light)
